p: In a study of 30 patients with stable CHD who underwent catheter intervention, thin-cap fibroatheroma (TCFA) detected by multivessel examination using optical coherence tomography was found independently associated with postprandial apoB48 ( 33). ApoB48 is the major apolipoprotein in chylomicron, and postprandial delayed hyperchylomicronemia is considered to be related to the destruction of the TCFA composed of the large lipid core under the fibrous cap in the pathogenesis of acute coronary syndrome (ACS), consequently ( 34).
